title: Gym Workout Place — Modern dark fitness marketing website (multi-page, mobile responsive)

requirements.text: Create a coherent, modern “WordPress gym theme” visual design system for the site and apply it consistently (dark energetic palette: black/red/dark grey; bold headings; strong CTA buttons; clean spacing; professional fitness vibe).

quotes: Create a modern, professional, mobile-responsive gym website using WordPress design style.
Dark & energetic fitness theme (black, red, dark grey)
all think right you build website

acceptanceCriteria: All pages share a consistent header/footer, typography scale, button styles, spacing, and dark theme colors (black/red/dark grey).
Primary CTAs are visually prominent and accessible (contrast, focus states).
Layout is mobile-first and responsive across common breakpoints.

requirements.text: Implement site-wide layout components: sticky header navigation with links to Home, About, Workouts/Programs, Trainers, Membership/Plans, Gallery, Contact; footer with social media icons/links; smooth scrolling for in-page anchor navigation where applicable.

quotes:
Extra Features:

Sticky header navigation

Smooth scrolling

Footer with social media icons

acceptanceCriteria: Header remains visible while scrolling and provides navigation to each page.
Footer includes social icons that link to placeholder external URLs (configurable).
Smooth scrolling is enabled for anchor jumps without breaking normal routing.

requirements.text: Build the Home page for “Gym Workout Place” with: hero image, headline “Transform Your Body. Transform Your Life.”, sub-text, and CTA buttons (Join Now, Free Trial, Contact Us); plus sections: Why Choose Us (Certified Trainers, Modern Equipment, Affordable Plans), Popular Workouts (with images), Member Transformation Highlights, and Testimonials.

acceptanceCriteria: Home hero displays the exact headline and sub-text provided.
CTA buttons are visible above the fold on mobile and route/scroll to appropriate sections/pages (Join Now → Plans, Free Trial → Contact form, Contact Us → Contact page/section).
Why Choose Us shows exactly the three benefit items specified.
Popular Workouts, Transformations, and Testimonials render with images and readable content on mobile and desktop.

requirements.text: Create the About Us page with a professional gym interior hero image, the provided mission text, and a values section listing: Discipline, Consistency, Results.

quotes:
About Us

Professional gym interior image

Text:

Values: Discipline, Consistency, Results

acceptanceCriteria: About page includes the exact provided paragraph and the three values.
Hero image renders correctly on mobile and desktop (no overflow/layout shift).

acceptanceCriteria: All nine programs are present, each with an image and a 2–3 line description.

requirements.text: Create the Trainers page showing professional trainer images and trainer cards including: “Certified Fitness Coach”, “Experience in weight loss & muscle building”, and “Personal training support”.

requirements.text: Create the Contact Us page with: contact form, WhatsApp button, Call Now button, Google Map location link, and business info (address, phone number, opening hours). Use external links for WhatsApp and Google Maps (no embedded map/API requirement).

quotes:
Contact Us Page

Contact form

WhatsApp button

Call now button

Google Map location

Address, phone number, opening hours
For features like WhatsApp button and Google Map, should these function as simple external links, since direct WhatsApp API and embedded maps are not supported?
all think right you build website

acceptanceCriteria: Contact form validates required fields and shows a success state after submission.
WhatsApp and Call buttons are actionable on mobile (tel: link for call; https://wa.me/... link for WhatsApp) using configurable placeholders.
Map is provided as an external Google Maps link (opens in new tab).
Business info (address/phone/hours) is displayed on the page.

requirements.text: Implement backend support for contact form submissions: store submitted messages (name, email/phone, message, timestamp) in the single Motoko actor and expose query/update methods for creating and (optionally) listing submissions for demo/admin debugging.

quotes: Contact form

acceptanceCriteria: A backend update method accepts a contact submission payload and persists it.
A backend query method can return recent submissions (suitable for verifying the form works).
No schema migration file is introduced unless persistent state requires upgrade handling.

requirements.text: Ensure the site is SEO-friendly: semantic heading hierarchy (H1/H2/H3), sensible page titles/meta defaults per route, and accessible components (labels for form fields, keyboard navigable menus, focus states).

quotes: SEO-friendly structure

acceptanceCriteria: Each page has exactly one H1 and logical subsequent headings.
Page titles are set per route (e.g., “Home | Gym Workout Place”).
Form fields have associated labels; interactive elements are keyboard accessible and show visible focus states.

requirements.text: Add generated image assets to the frontend as static files and wire them into the UI (store under frontend/public/assets/generated and reference them from pages/cards).

quotes: Professional gym photography with strong lighting
Professional trainer images
all think right you build website

acceptanceCriteria: All required generated images exist under frontend/public/assets/generated.
Home/About/Programs/Trainers/Gallery use the generated images (no broken links).
The site remains performant (use reasonable image dimensions for their usage).

constraints: Frontend files under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, and frontend/src/components/ui must not be edited (compose them instead).
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo; only add backend/migration.mo if state upgrades are necessary.
nonGoals: Implementing the site in WordPress (the build is React + Motoko while visually resembling a WordPress gym theme).
Embedding interactive Google Maps or using Google Maps APIs (use external link only).
WhatsApp API integration (use external wa.me link only).
Payments, subscriptions, or member login accounts.
